sentence.text: Abnormal prion proteins are responsible for several fatal neurodegenerative diseases in humans and in animals, including Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (positive regulation of peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation), Gerstmann-StrÃ¤ussler-Scheinker disease, and fatal familial insomnia.

In addition, different prion mutations were suggested to play a possible role in additional phenomuscle organ developments, such as Alzheimer's type pathology, spongiform encephalopathy, or frontotemporal dementia.
